body: The Node code looks right, though I'm not entirely familiar with the ES6 idioms. The error says (if you scroll far enough) "Trying to connect an http1.x server". Is it possible that the environment variable `LIBRARY_SERVICE_URL` is set, and you're not actually connecting to the local server? Are you sure that the Go server is successfully listening on that port, and that some other HTTP 1 server isn't already listening there?

@murgatroid99 Nah, env var isn't set. Happens for all GRPC Node apps in my host environment. It's quite a peculiar issue... source code works fine in Docker container. Happy to dive deeper... just a bit stuck, let me know if you have any debugging tips. Thanks!

If it's happening to every gRPC Node app in your host environment, the simplest explanation is that they are actually connecting through a proxy, as was mentioned in the issue you linked. In general, to get a lot of debugging information, you can run the Node client with the environment variables `GRPC_TRACE=all GRPC_VERBOSITY=DEBUG`. A dump of that log from a run of the client could help find the source of the problem. If you decide to share it, check that it doesn't have anything private.

I am experiencing a similar issue. Running a `node` client against a `go` grpc server on `Mac OS X`. 

I am streaming data from the server to the client. The client always fails due to this error once it gets between 6,000 and 12,000 messages into the response


It seems like this error may be related to https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/issues/1192

@mehrdada does this look familar to you? The error reproduces on `Ubuntu 14` as well (node client / golang server). 

```
D0613 21:16:33.311846000 140736045106112 connectivity_state.c:185]     SET: 0x10201c3b0 (null): READY --> SHUTDOWN [selected_changed] error=0x1020a2120 {"created":"@1497413793.310465000","description":"Delayed close due to in-progress write","file":"../src/core/ext/transport/chttp2/transport/chttp2_transport.c","file_line":591,"referenced_errors":[{"created":"@1497413793.310464000","description":"Failed parsing HTTP/2","file":"../src/core/ext/transport/chttp2/transport/chttp2_transport.c","file_line":2166,"grpc_status":14,"referenced_errors":[{"created":"@1497413793.310461000","description":"frame of size 102 overflows incoming window of 1","file":"../src/core/ext/transport/chttp2/transport/parsing.c","file_line":413}]}]}
```

"Delayed close due to in-progress write"
"frame of size 102 overflows incoming window of 1"

We are using `grpc@1.3.8`

There was an integer overflow bug in flow control logic that should be already fixed in HEAD in the Go implementation. Can you please try this with the Go HEAD and see if the issue exists? Otherwise it is very likely that you are encountering the same issue.

Thank you @mehrdada for your rapid response. It would appear that the issue does not persist after upgrading to `Go` HEAD. I suppose this is a little obvious in hind sight.

Thank you for your help!

I'm going to close this issue as it is likely a duplicate of grpc/grpc-go#1192. If you are facing this, please make sure you upgrade your Go side to HEAD and please do let us know if similar issues persist despite Go endpoints being updated. Thanks!
